line_2: The lowly Gill that never dares to climb;
And more I fain would sing, disdaining here to rhime.

line_1: Adorn'd with green myrtle and thyme.
line_2: A crook, and a garland so fine,

line_1: Crops the grey coral moss, and hoary thyme,
line_2: Or laps with rosy tongue the melting rime;

line_1: Where every molehill is a bed of thyme;
line_2: Adown the slope, then up the hillock climb,
